pullRequest.body:
Prove `strictMono_of_lt_succ` and `strictAnti_of_pred_lt` for archimedean orders.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [52b34dca39](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16732/commits/52b34dca39e75f90e4c4a2dd7190ab39be7655dd)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ strictAnti_of_pred_lt`
`+ strictMono_of_lt_succ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Is `strictMonoOn_Iic_of_lt_succ` not exactly what you're looking for? I understand what's wrong with it. Or do you want a version for `Iio` instead? Should be easy to prove from there.

> Is `strictMonoOn_Iic_of_lt_succ` not exactly what you're looking for? I understand what's wrong with it. Or do you want a version for `Iio` instead? Should be easy to prove from there.

If #15950 will give us `IsSuccArchimedean (Iio Ï‰)` then we just need `strictMono_of_lt_succ` ~with the preorder assumption replaced with a linear order~, right? It's trivial from `strictMonoOn_Iic_of_lt_succ` but doesn't seem to exist. I can just prove it here and then `strictMono_of_succ_lt_omega` follows from `IsSuccArchimedean (Iio Ï‰)`.

Thanks!

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10864684012/job/30150233739)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10864684012/job/30150233934)
Makes sense. Now that you have updated the content of the PR, can you update its title and description?

```suggestion
  (strictMonoOn_Iic_of_lt_succ fun m _ â†¦ hÏˆ m) h.le le_rfl h
```
Can you also add `strictAnti_of_pred_lt`?
Should this not be ...succ_lt?
Yeah, and also, we should have `pred` versions of these statements too.
Wow sorry, I was clearly tired when I maintainer merged this. @YnirPaz, mind opening a follow-up PR?
Wow sorry, these names are somehow short-circuiting my brain. #16813

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/Interval/Set/Monotone): strictMono_of_lt_succ
